results.title: Connie the cow: a curious butterfly
results.creator_credit: Neptuno Films, Cristina Brandner and Josep Viciana
results.brief_description: Join Connie the Cow, the very curious cow, in six colourful animated adventures. We all know that Connie loves to explore, make new friends and play. She is young and very mischievous. Every morning she wakes to explore the farm with her friends and brings about some exciting adventures. Music by Josep Roig.

results.title: Connemara and its ponies
results.brief_description: A visual essay on Connemara, situated on the west coast of Eire, in spring and autumn. Includes scenes of the wildlife, the ponies, and the life of the people on the farms.
results.description: A visual essay on Connemara, situated on the west coast of Eire, in spring and autumn. Includes scenes of the wildlife, the ponies, and the life of the people on the farms.

results.title: Connecting
results.creator_credit: Olivia Walker, Emma Reid and Bailey Humphries
results.brief_description: Grandma Swift laments her disconnectedness from the outside world, a quick idea takes a comical journey through modern and old time methods of communication leading to a modern day twist at the end.

results.creator_credit: Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and Roger Sandall

results.title: Congo: the way ahead
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Office of Public Information, George Movshon, Frank Jacoby and Robert Morgan
results.brief_description: Through the eyes of a 15-year-old Congo schoolboy, reveals the current (1963) situation in the Congo. The tragic circumstances which since 1960 have led to a decline in the standards of living of millions of people - the story of the patient painstaking efforts of the Congo people to build a modern and flourishing state are vividly portrayed, and the UN efforts to help.

results.title: Congenital broncho-oesophageal fistula in an adult
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Francois Seguillon, Jean Roy and Claudia Overing
results.brief_description: This is a film record of a surgical operation, performed in a Montreal hospital in December, 1968, to correct a rare congenital anomaly in a sixty-six year old male - a case in which there was a fistula between the normal oesophagus and a bronchial segment. A report of this case was published in the Canadian Medical Association Journal, May 9, 1970, v. 102.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Francois Seguillon, Jean Roy and Claudia Overing

results.title: Confucianism and the Taiwan experience
results.creator_credit: Kwang Hwa Mass Communications and Wu Li-Ching
results.brief_description: Confucianism focuses on diligence, thrift, harmony and love of learning. This documentary looks at how the people of Taiwan have taken these values to heart in the economic rebuilding of their country. Modern Taiwan is drawing on the spirit of Confucianism for inspiration as the republic progresses towards the 21st Ccentury.

results.title: Confucianism and Taoism
results.brief_description: The religious traditions of Confucianism and Taoism have influenced the lives of billions of people in China and around the world. Confucianism shapes the spiritual and ethical considerations of its followers, while Taoism stresses a harmony with nature and the life force within one’s self. This video, narrated by Ben Kingsley, describes the life of Confucius and how his philosophy and social doctrine have influenced Chinese culture. It also investigates the world of Taoism - its philosophy and its rituals.
